definition: to wail at a funeral/formal wailing while offering sacrifice to the departed
to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged
to pull a long face/sullen/also written 哭喪著臉|哭丧着脸
mourning staff draped in white, held at a funeral to show filial piety

sentences.english: Women invited to join the crying in the room where the coffin was placed.
sentences.chinese: 坐在灵堂里专门请来哭丧的女人。

sentences.english: The children pulled a long face.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们一个个都哭丧着脸。

sentences.english: Yikes, " she wrote, along with a rather somber pic of herself in the dentist's chair."
sentences.chinese: 随之上传了一张自己坐在牙医椅上哭丧着脸的照片。

sentences.english: Ah Liu suddenly entered with a woeful look and asked for a tip.
sentences.chinese: 阿刘忽然进来，哭丧着脸向他讨小费。

sentences.english: Men wander around for hours with their faces collapsed.
sentences.chinese: 但是男人们会哭丧着脸在大厅里踱上几个小时。

sentences.english: I'll never face low head, afraid of being seen.
sentences.chinese: 我就哭丧着脸低着头，害怕被别人看到。

definition: to cry out loud without tears
to bawl/to cry/to wail/to howl/also written 號哭|号哭[hao2 ku1]
to pull a long face/sullen/also written 哭喪著臉|哭丧着脸
to weep/to howl as if at a funeral
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
